intro: Laseguea erecta subvar. obliquinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined erect laseguea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with distinct, narrow veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
